update.description:
This PR allows the pose given to ContainPlugin to be in a frame other than the world. A pose relative to a moveable entity means the ContainPlugin's box will move with it.

![Peek 2018-02-15 15-50.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1797964556-Peek%202018-02-15%2015-50.gif)

`gazebo --verbose /worlds/contain_plugin_moving_demo.world`

and in another terminal

`gz topic -e /gazebo/default/drill/contain`
update.title: ContainPlugin support for moving geometry

This PR allows the pose given to ContainPlugin to be in a frame other than the world. A pose relative to a moveable entity means the ContainPlugin's box will move with it.

![Peek 2018-02-15 15-50.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1797964556-Peek%202018-02-15%2015-50.gif)

content.raw:
entity and the reference entity are referenced using weak_ptr in d2db3c52a983.

If the entity is removed from the world then the plugin considers it the same as the box not containing it. Likewise if the reference entity is removed then the entity couldn't be contained by the box.
content.html:
entity and the reference entity are referenced using weak_ptr in d2db3c52a983.

If the entity is removed from the world then the plugin considers it the same as the box not containing it. Likewise if the reference entity is removed then the entity couldn't be contained by the box.

update.description:
This PR allows the pose given to ContainPlugin to be in a frame other than the world. A pose relative to a moveable entity means the ContainPlugin's box will move with it.

![Peek 2018-02-15 15-50.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1797964556-Peek%202018-02-15%2015-50.gif)

`gazebo --verbose /worlds/contain_plugin_moving_demo.world`

and in another terminal

update.title: ContainPlugin support for moving geometry

content.raw:
I think both `containerEntity` and `entity` should be weak pointers with logic that reacquires those pointers if they're deleted and readded to the world.

Right now if `containerEntity` is removed from the world it wouldn't be deleted because this shared_ptr keeps the reference alive. The pose cached in `containerEntity->worldPose` would forever be where it was while it was still in the world.
content.html:
I think both containerEntity and entity should be weak pointers with logic that reacquires those pointers if they're deleted and readded to the world.

Right now if containerEntity is removed from the world it wouldn't be deleted because this shared_ptr keeps the reference alive. The pose cached in containerEntity->worldPose would forever be where it was while it was still in the world.

content.raw: Plugin returns without publishing if it can't find the entity defining the frame of reference in bd05e1a79b7e.
content.html: Plugin returns without publishing if it can't find the entity defining the frame of reference in bd05e1a79b7e.

content.raw: Sorry I meant to publish "doesn't contain", or just don't publish at all
content.html: Sorry I meant to publish "doesn't contain", or just don't publish at all

content.raw: what do you mean `returning false`? This is an update callback
content.html: what do you mean returning false? This is an update callback

content.raw: In case the entity hasn't been inserted into the world yet, the plugin will start working in the world frame and then change behaviour once the entity is inserted. What do you think of returning false if a frame was specified but the entity doesn't exist?
content.html: In case the entity hasn't been inserted into the world yet, the plugin will start working in the world frame and then change behaviour once the entity is inserted. What do you think of returning false if a frame was specified but the entity doesn't exist?

content.raw: should this be a weak pointer? I'm wondering what happens if the containerEntity gets deleted
content.html: should this be a weak pointer? I'm wondering what happens if the containerEntity gets deleted
